column4: Only some key packages are needed like the kernel and mysql for example on a db server
Are you saying you want to be able to upgrade the kernel and mysql without upgrading the rest?
yes
How come?
i don t really care to have a old version of ps, ls and so on
In English, "don't care to" actually means "do not want to" - I think you mean "I don't care *if* I have an old version of ps, ls, and so on".
sorry :) but you get the  point
Why do you need the upgrades to the kernel and mysql though?  Trying to understand the business case here.
only for performance and features, like new hardware or improved performance in mysql
Okay, but if you're upgrading major system components, what's the reason *not* to upgrade the little stuff?
let s say you are a big LAMP shop, the only package we really care about are L A M P
because it is a lot of trouble to upgrade from on LTS to another, a lot of things change, for example upstart
upstart is useless for us and only gives us new issues
the little things gives you a lot of little issues
I guess that makes some sense.  Are you able to get the packages you need from the backports repository?
most of the time we backport them ourselves
storing them on an internal reprepro
Okay, but do you have to?  If they're already in backports then the functionality you're describing is already available.
there is no 2.6.38 kernel for karmic or mysql/mariadb/percona 5.5
Um, of course not.  Karmic is EOL.  There isn't anything for it.
the same for lucid
